lead_paragraph: It is hard to imagine the Republican Party returning anytime soon to being the party of free trade, democracy building and at least modest immigration reform.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and ALEXANDER BURNS

headline.print_headline: Trump’s Journey: From Crashing a Party to Controlling Its Future
headline.main: Donald Trump’s Journey: From Crashing a Party to Controlling Its Future

snippet: It is hard to imagine the Republican Party returning anytime soon to being the party of free trade, democracy building and at least modest immigration reform....
abstract: Donald J Trump's ascension to Republican Party's presidential nominee leaves many wondering how party will fare under his direction or in wake of his failed presidential bid; Trump's departure from conservative principles has drawn new members into Republican Party, while also driving many Republicans away.
